Package ru.nsu.vetrov

Class Snake

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.nsu.vetrov.Snake
  • public class Snake
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a snake in a game, which can be controlled manually or by AI. Handles movements, direction changes, growth, and boundary interactions within a defined grid.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Snake​(Point startPosition, int width, int height, boolean isAi, java.util.function.Supplier<Direction> aiStrategy)
      Constructs a new Snake.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canChangeTo​(Direction newDirection)
      Returns true if the snake can legally move in the given direction.
      void changeDirection​(Direction direction)
      Sets the snake's direction directly, used for testing or overriding movement.
      Direction getDirection()
      Returns the current direction of the snake.
      java.util.List<Point> getPoints()
      Returns a list of points that make up the snake's body.
      Direction getReverseDirection()
      Gets reverse direction.
      void grow()
      Extends the snake's length by adding a new head at the next position.
      boolean intersects​(Point point)
      Checks if the snake intersects with a specified point.
      void move()
      Moves the snake in its current direction, updating its position on the grid.
      Point peekNextMove()
      Calculates the next position of the snake's head based on the current direction.
      Point peekNextMoveInDirection​(Direction direction)
      Calculates the next head position in a specific direction without changing the snake's actual direction.
      void setDirection​(Direction newDirection)
      Sets the snake's direction unless it's directly opposite to the current direction.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Snake

        public Snake​(Point startPosition,
             int width,
             int height,
             boolean isAi,
             java.util.function.Supplier<Direction> aiStrategy)
        Constructs a new Snake.
        Parameters:
        startPosition - the starting position of the snake's head
        width - the width of the grid the snake moves in
        height - the height of the grid the snake moves in
        isAi - whether the snake is controlled by an AI
        aiStrategy - the AI strategy to use for movement decisions

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves the snake in its current direction, updating its position on the grid.

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()
        Returns the current direction of the snake.
        Returns:
        the current movement direction

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection​(Direction newDirection)
        Sets the snake's direction unless it's directly opposite to the current direction.
        Parameters:
        newDirection - the new direction to set

      • peekNextMove

        public Point peekNextMove()
        Calculates the next position of the snake's head based on the current direction.
        Returns:
        the next head position as a Point

      • grow

        public void grow()
        Extends the snake's length by adding a new head at the next position.

      • getReverseDirection

        public Direction getReverseDirection()
        Gets reverse direction.

      • canChangeTo

        public boolean canChangeTo​(Direction newDirection)
        Returns true if the snake can legally move in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        newDirection - the direction to check
        Returns:
        true if the change is possible, false otherwise

      • peekNextMoveInDirection

        public Point peekNextMoveInDirection​(Direction direction)
        Calculates the next head position in a specific direction without changing the snake's actual direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction to peek the next move
        Returns:
        the next head position as a Point

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects​(Point point)
        Checks if the snake intersects with a specified point.
        Parameters:
        point - the point to check for intersection
        Returns:
        true if the point is part of the snake's body

      • changeDirection

        public void changeDirection​(Direction direction)
        Sets the snake's direction directly, used for testing or overriding movement.
        Parameters:
        direction - the new direction to set

      • getPoints

        public java.util.List<Point> getPoints()
        Returns a list of points that make up the snake's body.
        Returns:
        a list of points representing the snake's body
